review: I've been using the amazon fire TV for about a month now. It works great, has a huge number of apps to add functionality and is just all around a great device. I had the chromecast before I got this and I'm extremely happy I switched. I only have one gripe about this product and it's the reason I took off a star. There is a USB port on the back of the box that does absolutely nothing! I mean really amazon? You obviously put it there for a reason, and I for one would love to be able to plug a flash drive or external hard drive in to watch my movies. There's plenty of apps that allow you to stream from a server or nas box or even your desktop, but that kind of defeats the purpose when you have to set up multiple devices to work together just to watch your own digital media. That is my one and only complaint, if they updated the software to support external usb storage this would definitely be a five star product.

author: Ramon B. Maldonado Rosas

review: Received Amazon Fire TV as a Christmas gift, otherwise I had given no thought to such device.  I was able to stream similar content through my Wii gaming system.  The Wii continues to provide the services, but the operation of Fire TV is much more fluid from "binge watching" TV series and series made specifically for the streaming systems.  The recommendations are more accurate and in tune with my watching preferences.  The device is easier to search by categories, but similar to the Wii when searching by name.  It still requires subscriptions, but once have one, it applies to all accessible devices.  It turns off automatically and much sooner than the Wii even goes to standby mode.  I consider it a great gift and asset to my home viewing media of old and new.  This review pertains to the thin, square box device, not the plug-in device.  It truly is enhanced HDTV addition.
